question_text: A technician replaces a laptopâ€™s system board. After reassembly, Windows Hello facial recognition no longer works. What is the most likely reason?
answer_options: The TPM module was not cleared
The fingerprint reader is interfering with the webcam
The camera driver was replaced by a generic driver
The system was not connected to the internet
correct_answer: The camera driver was replaced by a generic driver
explanation: After motherboard replacements or reinstalls, the camera may default to a generic driver that doesn't support IR/biometric functions needed by Windows Hello.
